name: Puff Pastry Pinwheels with Smoked Salmon and Cream Cheese
author: Marianne
summary: Quick and easy puff pastry wheels with smoked salmon and cream cheese. I used herbed cream cheese, but you can use plain cream cheese as well.
ingredients: ½ (17.5 ounce) package frozen puff pastry, thawed
½ (8 ounce) container herbed cream cheese
1 sprig fresh dill, finely chopped, or to taste
directions: Dust a flat work surface lightly with flour
Unroll puff pastry and roll out to a rectangle
Spread a thin layer of herbed cream cheese over the puff pastry
Cover with smoked salmon slices and sprinkle with dill, leaving a 1-inch border
Roll puff pastry up tightly like a jelly roll and wrap in plastic wrap
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper
Slice puff pastry roll into 1/4-inch-thick slices and lay on the prepared baking sheet
Bake on the center rack of the preheated oven until lightly browned and puffed up, 20 to 25 minutes
